args:
Luca is gravely injured, but Isaac administers a
secret cure made from the spirit tree of Initio
that instantaneously heals his wounds. Luca is
eager to share this medical wonder with the
world, but Isaac insists that it remain a secret.
Sarisse, what is that weapon you carry?\nI have never seen its like before.
You're looking at a manacaster, baby!\nThey're still quite rare, but a princess\nfriend of mine gave me this one.
You count royalty among your\nacquaintances? Impressive.
THAT'S the part you're impressed with?\nNot my nutso future—er, ancient?—tech?
(Isaac's pretty straight-laced,\nbut he's also a little, uh...quirky.)
I'm not letting you hog all the glory, sis!\nHraaaaah!
You're a skilled marksman as well, Luca.
Darn tootin'. Back home, there aren't many\nwho can outshoot m—
His wound is deep. We need to get him\nback to the village for treatment at once.
I'm not NOT gonna worry about you!
Yes. A secret remedy passed down in\nInitio. One dose should be enough to heal\nhis injury.
(One little pill's not gonna cure a gash\nthis nasty.)
Think you can get this down, Luca?
What?! His wound isn't better; it's GONE!\nIsaac, what in the world did I just give my\nbrother?
A secret remedy made from the leaves of\nthe spiritree, steeped in Yggdrasil's mana.
If this is Yggdrasil's power, then...WOW!\nEven for a dragon, this is something else.
Just think of how much suffering you could\nease around the world with meds like this!
No. Word of this remedy must never be\nallowed to spread beyond the forest of\nInitio.
Even here, only a select few of us know of\nits existence. To bring it beyond our\nborders is out of the question. It is law.
What? You've got something this amazing\nhere and you're just gonna hide it away?!
If knowledge of this remedy left the\nvillage, it would bring war upon Initio.
Does the fact that it's a law now mean you\nhad that problem in the past?
And you gave something that precious to\nmy brother...
Thank you, Isaac. Please, don't worry. Your\nsecret is safe with us. You have my word.
I appreciate it. Now, I must return to my\nwork. You two should rest until tomorrow.
Rrgh. I still don't think it's right for one\ntiny village to keep a literal miracle cure\nhidden away from the world.
Isn't that the problem, though? That it's so\nincredible that everyone will fight over it?
If Yggdrasil's mana is what makes it so\npotent, every dose is like taking a portion\nof Yggdrasil's life. That isn't infinite.
I know. I know that, but...!
No buts, Luca. This is their way of life.\nTheir laws.
Isaac and the other people here have lived\ntheir whole lives protecting traditions like\nthese. It's not our place to say otherwise.
You're right, of course. But still, I...
We're done talking about this!\nI'll go draw some clean water for you.\nYou stay put and rest.
This morning's hunt was a success,\nthanks in large part to you, Sarisse.
To repay you, I'd like to take you to one\nof my favorite places. Follow me.
Wooow, it's so pretty! Nobody at the\nvillage mentioned anything like this.
It's at the forest's edge. And fiends are\nknown to appear along the path here, so\npeople rarely make the trip.
So it's your secret spot, huh?\nThat makes it even more exciting!
I'm pleased to see it bring such a smile to\nyour... Hm?!
It came from the nearby town.
Something must have happened!\nWe've got to hurry up and help them!
We cannot interfere in matters outside of\nour forest.
What? But I'm worried about them!
It was probably a landslide. A storm\npassed this area shortly before you two\narrived.
From the sound of the wind.
Really? Your ears must be better than\nmine, because I can't hear a thing.
It is a necessary skill for a guardsman of\nthe verdure. I can hear any disturbance in\nthe forest.
The wind tells of a new storm coming in\nhalf a month's time. We'll need to prepare.
Two big storms in as many weeks?\nIsn't that a little unusual?
The weather of Initio shifts with\nYggdrasil's mood.
If a storm is to come, it is because\nYggdrasil wishes it so.
(This wind grates in my ear as it passes...\nI hope mere rain and thunder are all that\nawait us.)
